text:
Katrín Jakobsdóttir (pronounced; born 1 February 1976) is an Icelandic politician. She is the 28th and current Prime Minister of Iceland since 30 November 2017. She has been a member of the Althing (Iceland's parliament) for the Reykjavík North constituency since 2007.
She became deputy chairperson of the Left-Green Movement in 2003 and has been their chairperson since 2013. Katrín was Iceland's Minister of Education, Science and Culture and of Nordic Co-operation from 2 February 2009 to 23 May 2013.
Other websites.
Katrín Jakobsdóttir was the second woman prime minister of Iceland and made it illegal to pay men more than women for the same job.
